alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Bryan; Coal; Johnston; Marshall (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 30 at 2:57AM CDT until March 30 at 3:15AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM CDT FOR EASTERN JOHNSTON...WESTERN BRYAN...SOUTHWESTERN COAL...EASTERN MARSHALL AND SOUTHWESTERN ATOKA COUNTIES... At 257 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles southeast of Connerville to 3 miles southeast of Milburn to near Lake Texoma, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Durant, Kingston, Colbert, Caddo, Achille, Wapanucka, Silo, Milburn, Kenefic, Bromide, Mead, Armstrong, Hendrix, Cartwright, Woodville, Olney, Fillmore, Coleman, Little City and Nida. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
